body: It probably requires that someone debugs this on an OpenBSD box...

It looks as if TFTP requests were executed twice:
```
   % Total    % Received % Xferd  Average Speed   Time    Time     Time  Current
                                  Dload  Upload   Total   Spent    Left  Speed
 
   0     0    0     0    0     0      0      0 --:--:-- --:--:-- --:--:--     0
 100    41    0    41    0     0  50679      0 --:--:-- --:--:-- --:--:-- 50679
 
 100    41    0    41    0     0  45253      0 --:--:-- --:--:-- --:--:-- 45253
```

Is there any place to look for clues?

issue.title: GHA: add NetBSD, OpenBSD, FreeBSD/arm64 and OmniOS jobs

repository.name: curl
repository.description: A command line tool and library for transferring data with URL syntax, supporting DICT, FILE, FTP, FTPS, GOPHER, GOPHERS, HTTP, HTTPS, IMAP, IMAPS, LDAP, LDAPS, MQTT, POP3, POP3S, RTMP, RTMPS, RTSP, SCP, SFTP, SMB, SMBS, SMTP, SMTPS, TELNET, TFTP, WS and WSS. libcurl offers a myriad of powerful features

issue.body:
Add these jobs to GHA:
- NetBSD, cmake-unity, clang, OpenSSL, x86_64, with tests, w/o python,
  no parallelism (was flaky sometimes)
- OpenBSD, cmake-unity, clang, LibreSSL, x86_64, with tests,
  with python, -j8, TFTP results ignored due to #13623.
- FreeBSD, cmake-unity and autotools, clang, OpenSSL, arm64
  (Tests disabled for arm64, because they are slow. It's available for
  x86_64 with python, -j12.)
  Configuration matches our existing Cirrus CI one.
- OmniOS, autotools, gcc, OpenSSL, x86_64, with tests, -j12.

All build with websockets and examples.

Closes #13583

---

- [x] cmake debug configuration might be simplified once #13592 (or a variant) landed.
- [x] see how to make `cpp` work on OmniOS. [FIXED by symlinking `cpp` to `gcpp`.]
- [x] fix test1167 on OpenBSD. → #13634
- [x] FIXME: TFTP tests on OpenBSD: https://github.com/curl/curl/actions/runs/9042288591/job/24855020568?pr=13583#step:3:3443 → #13623 → converted to a FIXME comment and executing these test but ignoring the result.
- [x] convert FreeBSD job to cmake for more variation.

rename.from: TFTP tests consistently fail on OpenBSD

body:
`tftp_do()` is only called once:
```
=== Start of file stderr271
   % Total    % Received % Xferd  Average Speed   Time    Time     Time  Current
                                  Dload  Upload   Total   Spent    Left  Speed
 
   0     0    0     0    0     0      0      0 --:--:-- --:--:-- --:--:--     0DEBUG: tftp_do() begin
 DEBUG: tftp_do() end result:|0| done:|0|
 
 100    36    0    36    0     0  28548      0 --:--:-- --:--:-- --:--:-- 28548
 
 100    36    0    36    0     0  26607      0 --:--:-- --:--:-- --:--:-- 26607
=== End of file stderr271
```
Ref: https://github.com/curl/curl/actions/runs/9076301772/job/24938697525#step:3:3515
Using this patch for tracing: https://github.com/curl/curl/pull/13583/commits/6db4aee57e8178483853937ea1d8b5ee8aae4b7b

Found this in every log (not sure how I missed it before!):
```
curl: (69) TFTP: Access Violation
```
Ref: https://github.com/curl/curl/actions/runs/9076301772/job/24938697525#step:3:3674

edit: Seems like a false lead...

issue.title: KNOWN_BUGS: TFTP tests fail on OpenBSD

repository.name: curl
repository.description: A command line tool and library for transferring data with URL syntax, supporting DICT, FILE, FTP, FTPS, GOPHER, GOPHERS, HTTP, HTTPS, IMAP, IMAPS, LDAP, LDAPS, MQTT, POP3, POP3S, RTMP, RTMPS, RTSP, SCP, SFTP, SMB, SMBS, SMTP, SMTPS, TELNET, TFTP, WS and WSS. libcurl offers a myriad of powerful features

body:
I've tried this on OpenBSD 7.7 and with the latest curl master, the tests now seem to be passing.
Outout of `TFLAGS="-j4" ./runtest.pl 271 283 284 285 286 332 1007 1009 1049 1093 1094 1099 1242 1243 2002 2003 3017`:

```
********* System characteristics ********                                                                                                                                                                       
* curl 8.14.1-DEV (x86_64-unknown-openbsd7.7)                                                                                                                                                                   
* libcurl/8.13.0 LibreSSL/4.1.0 zlib/1.3.1.1-motley nghttp2/1.65.0 ngtcp2/1.11.0 nghttp3/1.8.0                                                                                                                  
* Protocols: dict file ftp ftps gopher gophers http https imap imaps ipfs ipns mqtt pop3 pop3s rtsp smb smbs smtp smtps telnet tftp ws wss                                                                      
* Features: alt-svc AsynchDNS HSTS HTTP2 HTTP3 HTTPS-proxy IPv6 Largefile libz NTLM SSL threadsafe UnixSockets                                                                                                  
* Disabled: xattr, win32-ca-searchpath, win32-ca-search-safe, override-dns                                                                                                                                      
* Host: curlbsd.my.domain                                                                                                                                                                                       
* System: OpenBSD curlbsd.my.domain 7.7 GENERIC.MP#625 amd64
* OS: openbsd
* Perl: v5.40.1 (perl)
* diff: available
* Args: 271 283 284 285 286 332 1007 1009 1049 1093 1094 1099 1242 1243 2002 2003 3017
* Env: 
* Seed: 209999
* buildinfo.configure.tool: configure
* buildinfo.configure.args:  '--with-openssl' '--enable-tests'
* buildinfo.host: x86_64-unknown-openbsd7.7
* buildinfo.host.cpu: x86_64
* buildinfo.host.os: openbsd7.7
* buildinfo.target: x86_64-unknown-openbsd7.7
* buildinfo.target.cpu: x86_64
* buildinfo.target.os: openbsd7.7
* buildinfo.target.flags: UNIX BSD UNIX BSD
* buildinfo.compiler: CLANG
* buildinfo.compiler.version: 16.0
* buildinfo.sysroot: 
* Servers: HTTP-IPv6 HTTP-unix FTP-IPv6 
***************************************** 
test 0271...[TFTP retrieve]
--pd---e--- OK (1   out of 17 , remaining: 00:17, took 1.100s, duration: 00:01)
test 0283...[TFTP retrieve on invalid file]
--p----e--- OK (2   out of 17 , remaining: 00:09, took 0.091s, duration: 00:01)
test 0284...[TFTP retrieve of boundary case 512 byte file]
--pd---e--- OK (3   out of 17 , remaining: 00:06, took 0.100s, duration: 00:01)
test 0285...[TFTP send]
--p-u--e--- OK (4   out of 17 , remaining: 00:20, took 5.144s, duration: 00:06)
test 0286...[TFTP send of boundary case 512 byte file]
--p-u--e--- OK (5   out of 17 , remaining: 00:28, took 5.214s, duration: 00:11)
test 0332...[TFTP retrieve with blksize 400]
--pd---e--- OK (6   out of 17 , remaining: 00:21, took 0.090s, duration: 00:11)
test 1007...[TFTP send with invalid permission on server]
-rp----e--- OK (7   out of 17 , remaining: 00:16, took 0.085s, duration: 00:11)
test 1009...[TFTP retrieve with --local-port]
--pd---e--- OK (8   out of 17 , remaining: 00:13, took 0.086s, duration: 00:11)
test 1049...[TFTP retrieve with localhost --interface]
--pd---e--- OK (9   out of 17 , remaining: 00:10, took 0.083s, duration: 00:12)
test 1093...[TFTP retrieve with mode=i]
--pd---e--- OK (10  out of 17 , remaining: 00:08, took 0.087s, duration: 00:12)
test 1094...[TFTP retrieve with mode=netascii]
--pd---e--- OK (11  out of 17 , remaining: 00:06, took 0.087s, duration: 00:12)
test 1099...[TFTP get first a non-existing file then an existing]
s-p----e--- OK (12  out of 17 , remaining: 00:05, took 0.087s, duration: 00:12)
test 1242...[TFTP retrieve without TFTP options requests]
--pd---e--- OK (13  out of 17 , remaining: 00:03, took 0.081s, duration: 00:12)
test 1243...[TFTP send without TFTP options requests]
--p-u--e--- OK (14  out of 17 , remaining: 00:03, took 5.134s, duration: 00:17)
test 2002...[HTTP GET followed by FTP RETR followed by FILE followed by TFTP RRQ]
s-p----e--- OK (15  out of 17 , remaining: 00:02, took 2.199s, duration: 00:19)
test 2003...[HTTP GET followed by FTP RETR followed by FILE followed by TFTP RRQ then again in reverse order]
s-p----e--- OK (16  out of 17 , remaining: 00:01, took 0.233s, duration: 00:19)
test 3017...[MQTT SUBSCRIBE with pathological PUBLISH length]
--p----e--- OK (17  out of 17 , remaining: 00:00, took 1.106s, duration: 00:21)
TESTDONE: 17 tests were considered during 21 seconds.
TESTDONE: 17 tests out of 17 reported OK: 100%
```

I've also tested it in CI here: https://github.com/jacobmealey/curl/actions/runs/15363167553/job/43232763266?pr=1 
where the only change is: 
```diff
diff --git a/.github/workflows/non-native.yml b/.github/workflows/non-native.yml
index b78853b8d..b8cacdadf 100644
--- a/.github/workflows/non-native.yml
+++ b/.github/workflows/non-native.yml
@@ -112,7 +112,7 @@ jobs:
             bld/src/curl --disable --version
             if [ '${{ matrix.arch }}' = 'x86_64' ]; then  # Slow on emulated CPU
               time cmake --build bld --target testdeps
-              export TFLAGS='-j8 ~3017 ~TFTP ~FTP'  # FIXME: TFTP requests executed twice? Related: `curl: (69) TFTP: Access Violation`?
+              export TFLAGS='-j8'
               time cmake --build bld --target test-ci
             fi
             echo '::group::build examples'
```

I've been trying to get curl spun up on OpenBSD 7.5, but it's proving to be a bit of a hassle. 

Also if known bugs discussions should happen somewhere else, I'm happy to move this wherever it's most appropriate.

EDIT:
I've got curl 8.8.0 compiling on OpenBSD 7.5 (I think this is roughly the same configuration as when this issue was first opened) and the tests are _still_ passing. very confusing.

issue.title: GHA/non-native: un-ignore tests on OpenBSD, bump to `-j8` for NetBSD/FreeBSD

repository.name: curl
repository.description: A command line tool and library for transferring data with URL syntax, supporting DICT, FILE, FTP, FTPS, GOPHER, GOPHERS, HTTP, HTTPS, IMAP, IMAPS, LDAP, LDAPS, MQTT, POP3, POP3S, RTMP, RTMPS, RTSP, SCP, SFTP, SMB, SMBS, SMTP, SMTPS, TELNET, TFTP, WS and WSS. libcurl offers a myriad of powerful features

issue.body:
- un-ignore tests (3017, FTP, TFTP) on OpenBSD
  Patch-by: Jacob Mealey
  Ref: https://github.com/curl/curl/issues/13623#issuecomment-2925129037
  Fixes: #13623

- KNOWN_BUGS: drop TFTP failures issue on OpenBSD.
  Fixes: #13623

- bump test parallelism to `-j8` (from `-j4`) for NetBSD, FreeBSD,
  to match OpenBSD.
  Before: https://github.com/curl/curl/actions/runs/15371760479
  After: https://github.com/curl/curl/actions/runs/15371937205

- FreeBSD: sync cmake `TFLAGS` with autotools. (This branch is not
  currently hit in CI.)
  Follow-up to 7f3d598276e988a46558fe6a2951b1ae354afcdf #15040

body: @jacobmealey Nice find, I can confirm! PR: #17505
